snippet: In Egypt, the first new Coptic pope in more than four decades promised a new era of tolerance between the country’s Christian minority and the politically-dominant Muslims.
abstract: Tawadros II, first new Coptic pope in more than four decades, promises an era of tolerance between Egypt's Christian minority and politically-dominant Muslims; Tawadros indicates that he will reverse the explicitly political role of his predecessor, Pope Shenouda III.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh and Mai Ayyad contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In Egypt, the first new Coptic pope in more than four decades promised a new era of tolerance between the country’s Christian minority and the politically-dominant Muslims.

headline.seo: Coptic Church Chooses Pope Who Rejects Politics
headline.main: Coptic Church Chooses Pope Who Rejects Political Role
headline.print_headline: Coptic Church Chooses Pope Who Rejects Political Role

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
